solution_line_template: She starts with ${weekly_savings_phase1} a week for {duration_phase1} weeks so that's {weekly_savings_phase1}*{duration_phase1} = $<<{weekly_savings_phase1}*{duration_phase1}={savings_phase1}>>{savings_phase1}

Then she bumps it up to ${weekly_savings_phase2} a week for {duration_phase2} weeks so that's {weekly_savings_phase2}*{duration_phase2} = $<<{weekly_savings_phase2}*{duration_phase2}={savings_phase2}>>{savings_phase2}

After that, she saves ${weekly_savings_phase3} a week for {duration_phase3} weeks so that's {weekly_savings_phase3}*{duration_phase3} = $<<{weekly_savings_phase3}*{duration_phase3}={savings_phase3}>>{savings_phase3}
